am:content.h4: Q1: I have noticed some unexpected behaviour from the system, I think I have found a bug. What should I do now?

ol.li: try to find solution in this FAQ, Game manual or Support section of the Forum (you can use a search there)
refresh your browser cache either by pressing the F5 button once, while you are within the screen that causes the bug

refresh the entire browser cache manually (this differs for each browser)
Firefox
select Tools
select Clear recent history
have only the Cache checkbox checked
select Clear now
Chrome
select Tools
select Clear browsing data
have only the Empty the cache checkbox checked
select Clear browsing data
Opera
select Tools
select Delete private data
select Detailed options
have only the Delete entire cache checkbox checked
select Delete
document the bug (describe what you expected it to do and what happened instead, provide a screenshot, describe the situation when it happened, in which location and so on...)
report the bug on the Support section of the Forum or send it to either Mojko or theultramage, we will do what we can to solve the problem

am:content.h4: Q2: I can't log in. How do I fix that?
am:content.p: A: If you are sure you have used the right login and password, try to delete cookies for our site in your browser. You should find cookie management in options/preferences/advanced options.
am:content.h4: Q3: My browser doesn't display your site properly. You have errors in your website. Can you fix it?
am:content.p: A: We made this website according to W3C standards, so the cause is most likely the browser you're using. We know that Firefox, Opera or Chrome have no problems displaying it, perhaps you could try using one. Writing a report might not be a bad idea, too - it would help us make future plans.
am:content.h4: Q4: When I play a card, its cost should be subtracted from my stock, but it isn't. I ended up with more resources than I should have. Why is that?
am:content.p: A: The card cost is always the same as it is displayed on the card. There is no way these two values would differ. So you probably didn't realize that after the card is played (at the end of your turn), you get resources from your facilities. This is probably the reason why you ended up with more resources than you expected.
am:content.h4: Q5: What is a turn anyway? How it works?
am:content.p: A: Turn is one elementary step in a game you are playing. A turn consits of these steps:

ol.li: Cost of a card is substracted
Effect of the card takes place
Keywords with side-effects apply
Game limits apply (resources cannot be lower than 0, wall below 0, facitlies below 1...)
Resource production
End game condition is checked

am:content.h4: Q6: I played an if-then-else card, fulfilling the condition, but instead the secondary effect took place. Why?
am:content.p: A: Remember that this condition is evaluated AFTER the card cost is subtracted from your stock. This may be the reason why the secondary effect was chosen.
am:content.h4: Q7: I played a "Swift" card and I got an unexpected increase of resources. How does a "Swift" card work?
am:content.p: A: Simple - by playing a "Swift" card you get a full extra turn, including resource production.
am:content.h4: Q8: Is the number of "Swift"/"Quick" cards played in a row limited?
am:content.p: A: No. You can make arbitrarily long chains of "Swift"/"Quick" cards.
am:content.h4: Q9: I used F5 to refresh the game and for some reason a card was played by itself.
am:content.p: A: Use OUR refresh button (located on the left part of the screen, above your empire info), not the one on the browser. For quick access use shorcut ALT+w.
am:content.h4: Q10: Some cards have "recently discarded cards" in their effect. What does that mean?
am:content.p: A: Recently discarded cards are following cards:

ul.li: Card discarded by you with discard button last turn
Cards that were discarded by you last round by some card effect
Cards that were discarded by opponent last round by some card effect

am:content.h4: Q11: Some cards with modes like Militia, Vampire lord or Ranger for example can target their own position in hand. What will happen if I do that?
am:content.p: A: It depends on the card, when card is played, card related actions are executed in this order:

ol.li: Card effect
Keyword effect
Normal drawing - new card is added in place of the played one (can be disabled or effected by card effect or keyword effect)

am:content.p: When Militia or Ranger are played with mode that targets their own position, the card effect is overridden by normal drawing, because it happens as the last action. When Vampire lord is played with mode that targets his own position, it is different. Card effect adds a Vampire into the postion of the played card, but Durable keyword makes sure, that next card received by normal drawing will be the Vampire lord, so it will undo the card efect. In most cases it doesn't make much sense to play the mode that targets such position, but there can be situations when you may want to play it this way (for example, when you don't want to discard any of the cards from your hand).
am:content.h4: Q12: I want to install my own MArcomage server on my computer. How do I do that?

ol.li: download and install Subversion which will allow you to download MArcomage source code
download WAMP server (provided you have Windows OS), which will allow you to run local web server
install WAMP server (for example in 'C:/wamp')
create 'marcomage' directory in the 'wamp/www' directory

press 'Start' on bottom left part of windows toolbar, click 'run' and type 'cmd.exe', press 'ok' (in other words start Windows console). Type 'svn checkout https://svn.netvor.sk/arcomage C:\wamp\www\marcomage'. (this will download MArcomage source code to 'marcomage' directory)

Click on the small WAMP server icon with left mouse button in the right bottom part of the screen. A WAMP server menu will appear. Move mouse over 'PHP', then 'PHP extensions'. If 'php_xsl' extension is not enabled (doesn't have a check) enable it by clicking on it with left mouse button.

Start WAMP server, click on the small WAMP server icon in the right bottom part of the screen. Choose 'phpmyadmin' in the menu. Click on 'import'. Choose MArcomage DB install script (located in 'marcomage/release/scripts/install_tables.sql') and execute it.
open 'release/config.php' and change username value to 'root'
click on the WAMP server icon once again and choose 'localhost'. Click on the 'marcomage', then 'release' and you should now have your own MArcomage server
